meanings.definition: A low, short, guttural sound made by an animal or person.
meanings.sent1: The pig let out a loud grunt when it saw the food.
meanings.sent2: I heard a grunt coming from the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The grunt from the dog sounded like a funny hiccup.
meanings.sent4: The grunt of the engine signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The grunt of the bear echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: A low-ranking soldier in the military.
meanings.sent1: The grunt carried heavy equipment during the training.
meanings.sent2: The grunts lined up for inspection in the barracks.
meanings.sent3: The grunt's uniform was too big, making him look like a child playing dress-up.
meanings.sent4: The grunts stood at attention, ready for their orders.
meanings.sent5: The grunt's helmet gleamed under the sun.

meanings.definition: To make a low, short, guttural sound.
meanings.sent1: The dog will grunt when it wants attention.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally stepped on a toy, causing it to grunt.
meanings.sent3: The old floorboards grunt under the weight of each step.
meanings.sent4: The car engine started to grunt before roaring to life.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches grunt in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The workers grunt as they lift the heavy boxes.
meanings.sent2: He had to grunt through the tough workout.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to grunt dramatically while carrying the groceries.
meanings.sent4: The machine grunted as it strained to lift the load.
meanings.sent5: The athlete grunted with effort as he crossed the finish line.
